short_summary: Jetty Upgrade at Canadian Forces Base Halifax, Nova Scotia
description: The project aims to upgrade the jetty infrastructure at Canadian Forces Base Halifax to accommodate the new Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) vessel and other RCN vessels. The scope of work includes topographical and hydrographic surveys, geotechnical investigations, pre-design reports, option analysis, statement of construction requirements, concept design, design development, construction documents, and tender and construction phase services. The estimated value of the contract is $5 million.

**Government Tender Announcement**

**Procurement Information:**

* **Reference Number:** PW-23-01025976
* **Solicitation Number:** 78882-D
* **Publication Date:** February 15, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** March 22, 2023 (14:00:00)
* **Contracting Entity:** Defence Construction Canada

**Project Overview:**

The Department of National Defence requires a consultant to upgrade the jetty system at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Halifax in Nova Scotia. The project will involve modernizing the existing infrastructure to accommodate new classes of vessels, including the Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) fleet. The scope of work includes upgrades to the mechanical and electrical systems, rehabilitation work to the sub-structure and superstructure, and an expanded apron-laydown area.

The tender description can be found under the tender description section below.

**Tender Description:**

Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) Jetty “NB” Upgrade and Jetty “NH” Recapitalization – Canadian Forces Bases (CFB) Halifax, Nova Scotia (with Security Requirements)

This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) is not a bid solicitation but an opportunity for interested consultants to begin the sponsorship request process for obtaining the required security clearance(s) for the contract. The estimated value of the contract is approximately $5 million.

**Security Clearance Requirements:**

Consultants must hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of tender closing, which are anticipated to be a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), and Industrial Security Program (ISP) Sponsorship.

**Sponsorship Process:**

Defence Construction Canada (CDC) will provide preliminary assistance with the security clearance sponsorship process. Consultants interested in submitting a proposal should begin the sponsorship request application process by applying through CDC’s ISP.

**Contact Information:**

For further information, please contact Sean Brushett, Regional Service Line Leader, Defence Construction Canada, at sean.brushett@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or 902-440-5364.
